name: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here is March 2012 on honeymoon. Knowing nothing about Hawaii before we went, I can say it's absolutely in one of the best positions in Waikiki, there really is no difference between across the road and "on" the beach.
reviews.title: Can't fault Hyatt

reviews.text: We were on the 15th floor of the Diamond Head Tower in a deluxe ocean view room, I think we were upgraded because of our Honeymoon. It was a huge room, huge bed, huge bathroom, everything in the room was great. Decor a little dated but out of the 3 hotels we stayed in HI it was no different.
reviews.title: Great Stay, Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't really comment on value as we got this as part of a package. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel restaurants as it did look very expensive, although we were told by numerous taxi drivers etc that it was very good. The cafe at the pool was fine, good food and priced just as you'd expect a 5 star hotel to be priced. The pool service was very good.
reviews.title: Home away from Home!

reviews.text: It looks like one of the biggest hotels in Waikiki, with the 3 ABC stores on the premises and numerous other shops and the waterfall etc, it's all very nice. We didn't have any noise issues, Kalakaua Ave is noisy all the time so it's not really fair to complain about that, it's part of the attraction anyway!
reviews.title: Great sta in Waikiki

reviews.text: The staff were also very helpful with organising our airport shuttle, etc. And as other people have mentioned, definitely one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in!
reviews.title: Hyatt Regency Waikiki is one of the best

reviews.text: We chose this hotel based on the room size because we were going to be traveling with 2 teenagers. It was actually very large and comfortable. Wish that they had rooms with larger beds. Doubles are way to small no matter what your size! Otherwise the hotel was awesome. The location is better than being directly on the beach and much quieter. Everything you need is right there, even an ABC store on site. You can check out sand chairs to take to the beach, which is directly across the street. Barbara at the pool bar is absolutely the BEST, very nice and friendly. Check your bill closely cause they charge for everything whether you use it or not. But they were great about crediting any errors. Overall the right choice for us and would stay there again!!
reviews.title: Met all expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hyatt Waikiki for four nights and wished we stayed longer. This was our first trip to Hawaii and the first hotel we stayed at during our honeymoon (we also stayed at the Sheraton in Kauai *BLECK* and the Westin in Maui *eh*. The Hyatt was the perfect place for us since we are from NYC and are used to the hustle and bustle of things. Waikiki is a gorgeous city with PLENTY to do. The Hyatt itself is a beautiful property with a room to suit anyone. It is located across the street from the beach where you can take surfing lessons (we did!) and rent equipment. The restaurants at the Hyatt were so-so. Our room rate included a breakfast buffet every morning, ch was nice and not something we ever would have paid $24.95 each for. Musashi was very mediocre sushi, but they sent us free dessert while we were there since it was our honeymoon. Oh, and the free champagne! The hotel is very family friendly and offers kids' room service, which we ordered for dessert one night (horray for brownie sundaes that look like clowns!) If you're there do NOT miss the Elegant Dive, their poolside bar and grill or their spa-their lomi lomi couples massage is not to be missed. Barbara is the nicest server I have ever encountered and remembered us by name after lounging by the pool only once. The check-in and check-out process was a breeze and the staff was attentive to our needs. We will return as soon as we recover from the jetlag...
reviews.title: Beautiful Honeymoon with personalized service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During our four days' stay in Hyatt, the most memorable thing was their breakfast buffet (which was included for the hotel guests). The breakfast serves western traditional breakfast food with the additions of tasty Asian choices (there are a lot of Asian tourists staying in the hotel). The staff was very friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: Great Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we stayed at wasn't impressive. It was rather small. There is no fridge. We rented a fridge from the hotel for about $15. The fridge was tiny.
reviews.title: Hyatt Overbooked

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked the pool and hot tubs. Every night there was live music entertainment at the pool area.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but Nickled & Dimed
Unrealized Expectations
reviews.text: We stayed at this facility April 4&5, 2012 and we had an awesome view. After that there is nothing positive to report.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When the reservation was made we were told we would have a fabulous ocean front suite as a Diamond Member Suite Upgrade. When we arrived we found local management had made a unilateral decision to provide us with two connecting rooms (one of which was an ADA room) and describe that combination as a "Suite Upgrade."
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but over priced

reviews.text: The sink in the bathroom did not function properly, and maintenance advised us the remedy would be somewhat messy, and they would prefer to correct the situation while we were outside of the "suite upgrade."
reviews.title: EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE

reviews.text: On our last night at or about 10:00 PM we received a phone message staff had located other accommodations for our consideration. This was followed up with a hand written note card which which was found at or about 3:30 AM. With those two futile gestures hotel management could say affirmative steps were taken to resolve the situation. The definition of a "suite upgrade" does not seem to be consistent within the Hyatt system. As a Hyatt Diamond Member there is disappointment, and we will not be returning to this establishment.
reviews.title: Exceptional in Every Way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights in December 2011 for our honeymoon.
reviews.title: Slow elevators in Diamond Head tarnished our great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had a three night pre-cruise stay in late July at the Hyatt Waikiki booked on Gold Passport points in the Regency Club, mountain view. The room was large, newly redocorated and had a flat panel tv, as well as a view of Diamond Head and a balcony. The bed wasn't as comfortable as most Hyatts we have stayed at, but we were usually exhausted so it was fine. It was a little dark as it was on the shady side, but cool and comfortable. There was a coffee maker, but we never used it as we had Regency Club privileges.
reviews.title: Top notch stay(s) at the Hyatt Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main pool is very small, but there is a private rooftop sundeck with padded loungers, a hot tub, and free bottled water and towels for Regency Club guests. You can get free backpack beach chairs at the pool to take across the street to the famous Waikiki Beach. The location of the hotel is perfect--across the street from the best action on Waikiki with the beach boys and surfboard rentals. And a thirty second stroll to shopping, from the most expensive designer store to the ubiquitous ABC stores. There's also a good, cheap "beach bar" for inexpensive lunches and snacks on this beach, called "Hyatt on the Beach".
reviews.title: Don't bother- overrated

likes.disliked: — coffee maker in room but no coffee; $19/day fee for a fidge

reviews.text: We came back to the Hyatt for one night and most of the next day post cruise as we had a red eye flight to Vegas. Although we could not obtain Regency Club reservations on initial booking for this part of the trip, upon check-in we were upgraded to the Ambassador Suite since they could not get us a room near my parents, who were traveling with us. The suite was nearly 1600 square feet, with two huge bedrooms, two bathrooms, a living and a dining room with every amenity, including Regency Club service. Now that's an upgrade!
reviews.title: Awwfullll! Don't stay here!

likes.disliked: — Everything else, bathroom, amenities, restaurant, pool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cary, Mark, and Micheline of the Regency Club staff deserve special mention by name for their outstanding customer service--and I have seen them mentioned on several websites. They all go the extra mile every day for their guests. Cary and Mark's smiling interplay with guests and each other keep the cocktail hour guests entertained. Regency Club includes free continental breakfast in a private lounge and free evening cocktails and snacks. The food and drinks are always great, the service is stellar and it's fun to meet other guests in an intimate atmosphere. Oh, the service....they mailed my postcards for me, they brought me a fresh vegetable tray when they noticed I was looking for more...they gave me a "to go" cup to take my gin and tonic to the airport...and Micheline recommended tours, as well as checking us out in the Club and arranging for us to stay in the suite until 6 p.m. on checkout day (instead of 11 a.m.) Plus we could enjoy Regency Club hospitality until we left for the airport at 8 p.m.
reviews.title: Perfect Waikiki oasis

reviews.text: In short, having a regular room at the Hyatt may not be as special ---but if you can swing it, or are a Gold Passport member, I would highly recommend a stay here in the Regency Club. I'm dreaming of the day when I can go back. It's all about the service!
reviews.title: It wasn't Great AT ALL!

likes.disliked: — the fact that it's so big that the staff doesn't get to know each guest...there are toooo many people

reviews.text: This was our 6th trip to Waikiki in 20 years and by far the best location. Everything was just steps away and the Hyatt had so many wonderful features. Beautiful waterfalls, many shops, wonderful people working there and everybody was super helpful. We did ask for a upgrade which we where able to purchase and that was so nice looking out at Diamond Head and the wonderful beach and watching the surfers. Our granddaughter took surfing lessons right across from the hotel and loved that. The guys at the hut on the beach let her take out a surf board the next day the were great. Our room was great everything was clean and neat and the balcony was nice. At the pool they gave out beach chairs and towels which we used the week we stayed. We kept the chairs and took them in our rental car and used to go to bay snorkeling.The location of the hotel was really great. Easy access to the beach, the International Market place as well as all the other hotels and stores near the beach. There were many good places to eat at reasonable prices including Mc Donalds for a quick breakfast. One of our favorites was Lu Lu's which is about two blocks from the hotel toward the zoo. It has reasonable prices and a great ribeye steak dinner. On Friday the hotel hosted an event in the lobby from 4PM until 6PM which included shows, fresh cut pineapple, and crafts for kids. It was great. Overall we had a great vacation and would make the Hyatt our first choice in the future!!
reviews.title: Best Location and Wonderful Hotel
Thoroughly enjoy this property!
reviews.text: Sharon L April 4 - 12, 2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To start off.... This was not our first chosen hotel in Waikiki. We had originally booked at the outrigger across the street. A week later, our travel agent phoned to say that the room configuration we choose was not available. And that the hotel had since sold out. Not such a happy camper. We ended up at the Hyatt which met and exceeded my expectations. We had to book 2 rooms in order accommodate our family. My husband and I and out two teenage boys. The rooms were great. One king bed room and adjoining two double bed room. If I had one slightly negative comment it would be that the tub and bathroom are a bit dated. This hotel provided us with our first 5 days of a 16 day vacation..... And I think we enjoyed it the most! The beds and pillows were remarkable.... Everyone of us slept extremely well. I love.love.loved the toiletries provided. Used them everyday and brought a few along for the rest of our trip. another bonus for this property was the buffet breakfast (which was included with our room - a $29 per person value) which I have to thank them for being fabulous. Some of my family are not breakfast eaters, however the buffet had enough non breakfast items so that everyone could fill up.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is another great feature. Directly across from "Duke" statue on the beach. From our hotel they provided chairs and towels for at the beach. The after the beach step out onto ...hawaii's " Rodeo"drive. Everything was at your finger tips! Abc stores every third or fourth shop! Great sounds. Great food, great times. I would definitely recommend this property. From the reviews I had read prior to going....many reviewers encountered slow elevators. We encountered this once during our stay. We trying to come down and waited for about 8minutes...another family had said they had been waiting for 20 mins. Our remedy...go up a floor then go down. You could hear all these elevators going up but they just never seemed to stop on the way down. Within seconds of pushing the up ...we were riding the elevator.
reviews.title: awesome location and value with spectacular views

reviews.text: My husband is quite particular on the hotels we stayed in and we would go and stay at the Hyatt regency again! Thanks for providing us with all that we could ask for!
reviews.title: Waikiki beach hotel at the heart of Honolulu, Hawaii.

reviews.text: We were originally booked to stay for 2 nights on a budget Aqua Ocean Tower, but check out from that place after one night due to an extremely moldy room condition and smell. We landed Hyatt for $165 plus tax and fees (total of about $195) via Priceline on the morning of the check-in (about 10 am), packed up and arrived at Hyatt around 10:30 am, checked-in and left our luggage with the bell desk, and was admitted to our room around 1 pm.
reviews.title: Loved the ambience

reviews.text: Overall, the hotel was in great shape, and the amenities were top class. We're usually budget travelers, so this was a real treat at approximately $50 more than what we paid the previous night at the Aqua Ocean Tower. The rooms were about twice as large as the Aqua, and carried a fresh scent as soon as we opened the door to our room.
reviews.title: Wasn't The Best & Wasn't The Worst ....

likes.disliked: — Outdated and needs refurbishing in the Diamondhead Wing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Locationwise, Hyatt is a crosswalk away from the center of Waikiki action, and our family thoroughly enjoyed our one night stay. After we checked out the next morning, our flight to the Big Island wasn't until late in the evening, and when we asked for a hospitality unit to wash up after a day in Waikiki, they graciously offered us a unit for one hour. Overall, two big thumbs up for the Hyatt Waikiki. We'll definitey come back.
reviews.title: Loved the Hyatt

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hyatt Waikiki 8/1 - 8/3 in the Diamondhead Tower. I believe this area of the hotel is an older area, as it seemed a little outdated and needs some refurbishing. The carpets were a bit dirty in the cooridor areas and the rooms were not all that sound proof. You could hear the sounds from inside the rooms while in the cooridor area. The actual room we were in was in definite need of new carpet, it was grungy looking and some of the seams were coming up around the area of where it met the bathroom door so there were threads coming up. The actual bathroom where the toilet and shower/bath were was very small and the fixtures were very outdated. However, the bed was very comfortable and the linens were nice and the pillows quite plump and comfortable as well. The refridgerator of course was fully stocked with excessivly overpriced items, sode @ $2.50 per can, 16 oz bottle of Fuji Water was $5.50 per bottle, etc. but that's a hotel for you and to boot Hawaii too!! The location of the hotel is nice, however it's very hussle bussle and very busy all the time. The hotel restaurant breakfast buffet is extremely expensive, $25 a person, however children 4 and under eat free at the buffet with a paying adult which is nice. You can definitely eat enough so you don't need to eat lunch, or just need something light for lunch, so it kind of evens out paying that much, althought it is quite expensive. One thing to note when eating outside at the restaurant is the bird/pigeon problem. There are birds every where constantly trying to get at food left on tables from previous diners, and if you get up be careful your plate is either guarded or empty, because they will swoop in while you're gone. The waiters are constantly doing what they can to get the birds out of the area, however it is a little pesky while trying to eat and kind of ruins the whole outside thing. There are signs posted not to feed the birds, although they do a good job of finding their own food with out having to be fed by anyone. The conceiarge staff was nice and helpful, although I can't say the same for the bell staff. I asked for a cab and sat there for 15 minutes before I realized that they either ignored my request or forgot about it, needeless to say I had to ask again. The front desk staff (Danica especially) was very pleasant. Beware, if you don't bring your own computer there is one available in the business center to use to the tune of $0.65 per minute, which is quite a rip off, but Hawaii for you. The beach is great, and there is plenty of space, although it's always quite crowded. All in all I felt the hotel was satisfactory, it wasn't over the top, but it wasn't a motel 6 either. I think it's got some work to bring it up to a quote luxury property, although that may not be what they're looking to be considered either.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

likes.liked: — the location and the beautiful lobby
likes.disliked: — not enough signage by the lobby escalators for finding your tower elevators

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my 1st trip to Hawaii (Honolulu) and I must the admit the Hyatt lived up to its expectations. The entire staff was friendly and knowledgeable. The location was great (on the beach and around the corner from the International Marketplace - a great place to buy souvenirs). The rooms were spacious and clean. We even received a free room upgrade just by asking. I would recommend trying to book a room with the breakfast buffet included as food can get very pricey. I would also recommend getting a massage. It, too, was a little pricey but well worth it. I would definitely stay here again with my next visit to Hawaii.
reviews.title: Great location and that's all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights in a deluxe ocean front room on the 30th floor. The view was fantastic. The room was spacious and quiet, though the bathroom (ADA) was a bit dated. The Regnency Club served great food and the staff, especially Mark, was superb. I enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt Place down the block several months ago, but I would stay here for the view and the Regency Club.
reviews.title: Fantastic Waikiki Hotel

reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: --central Waikiki location, across the street from the beach.
reviews.title: Good views assured above the 15th Floor

reviews.text: --as close to a "resort" atmosphere as one can get in Waikiki, more than any other hotels I've stayed in for this area.
reviews.title: Great views came w noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: --Regency Club access: great breakfast, early evening canapes, and dessert. This is very high quaily food with excellent presentation. While the spread can't match Asian hotels (JW Marriott HK), it is probably the best you can get for a domestic lounge.
reviews.title: Wonderful time!

reviews.text: Our stay at the Hyatt Regency Waikiki was due to business, therefore nicer than we would normally allow ourselves! The only king bed accomodations available to us upon check-in was next to the elevator on the 8th floor (room 818). Another room was available the following day so we left our packed bags to be relocated while we were gone for the day. That was a relief! The elevator ran continually all night long and I felt like I was living over a train station. We had city views in both of the rooms. I believe that all rooms have a balcony with a table and chairs. The room had a nice-sized desk, armoire with drawers, television, game controller and keyboard and stocked mini bar. There was a nice long dresser with 6 drawers, two nightstands, radio alarm clock (that didn't work), mirrored closet in the bathroom with iron and board and blow dryer. Standard amenities like shampoo, conditioner, body gel, bar soap and lotion (eucalyptus scented). The fitness room was well stocked with Life Fitness equipment: 3 ellipticals, 3 treadmills, 2 bicycles, weight machines and free weights. The pool is relatively small for such a large hotel and gets quite crowded in the afternoon. Waikiki Beach is just across the street and those who don't like the beach end up at the pool. Friends ate at the restaurant by the pool with their children and said it was awful.
reviews.title: Wonderfully located

likes.liked: — walking distance to shopping, convention center and restaurants

reviews.text: The parking garage is across the street from the hotel and is as treacherous as other reviews have stated. If you rent a car, get a small car or just pay to have the valet park it. The spiral garage is very narrow and tight. Parking is charged daily but you have in and out privileges.
reviews.title: A great hotel in an unpleasant city

likes.disliked: — Oahu is not a pleasant place to visit.

reviews.title: Loved our stay
reviews.text: The Hyatt is a beautiful resort in a crowded, noisy megalopolis. Might as well have gone to Las Vegas...at least there's more entertainment and you don't have to endure a long flight from the mainland.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is huge, with a comprehensive menu of services. My room was large and inviting, if very...um...beige. Only a brightly-colored bolster atop the bed broke up the beige-ness of the room. The lanai was smallish but...what a view! Be sure to get the oceanfront view if you can. It's worth the extra money.
reviews.title: Great service & location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oahu in general was an interesting study. One of my lasting impressions is that whenever I turned around, I spotted another stripped, abandoned car. Even in late May (not, I understand, a peak tourist season but popular with conventions) the crowds were heavy.
reviews.title: Nice, but not as nice as the Hyatts on the other islands

aka: Hyatt Regency Waikiki Resort And Spa
description: Surround yourself with the magnificence and beauty of Hawaii at Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort and Spa. Our welcoming Waikiki hotel offers the ultimate combination of personalized service, outstanding amenities and a perfect location close to all that embodies our island. Stroll to such landmarks as Diamond Head, Honolulu Zoo and the Waikiki Aquarium from our spectacular setting fronting Waikiki Beach
